text: Please help me understand myself right now I was having fun and I guess I seemed drunk cause I was laughing a lot but I wasn t and   minutes later I was told by my mom if I didn t go to college this year that she would lose   dollars from tax write offs and that money pays for our food and ability to live in a apartment  I than tell her how that made me feel   like shit  and she said   well than forget what I said it s ok honey  well mom I can t forget what you just told me  That will burden me  I have a job interview tomorrow too  I m   btw  Anyways after a while of telling her I can t just forget and her telling me I can I went   real quick  I have a old habit of punching doors and breaking stuff and well it s been kinda long since I freaked out and I was pretty calm before and and BAM I punched   holes in   dif doors and than I punched the metal door a lot and than threw stuff like books off the counter and than I was moving a back back my throwing it under my right arm and BAM broke a glass panel in the China cabinet  Whoops but she thought it was on purpose  I told her sorry and helped her clean it up even in my rage   shows I actually cared  but she said that this morning my brother said sorry for something last night and what i just said was not sorry  So Idk why I went from   after being so good and even getting a interview for a job tomorrow and being happy the whole day  I m not bipolar I m pretty sure cause I have depression and I see people for help  I also was gonna swallow a whole bottle of pills but mom slapped my arm and pills went flying on floor  I didn t want to die but I was scared the police were gonna come and I was gonna go to juvie again or the mental hospital and that is a HUGE setback and I can t have that  I feel like I lost so much progress  Anyways thanks for reading if you took the time  I appreciate it and you mean the world to me

text: Just need to vent anonymously  and I feel this may be the best place In the last   years I have never been truly happy  It feels like there is always something in the back of my mind stopping me  I just think I m too sensitive and things affect me more than others  It s gotten to a point where I ve sort of accepted that s just how I am and will always be I guess It all started when I got into my first starting seeing a girl when I was   years old  and I completely fell for her   After a few months she ended it and it completely crushed me  I couldn t sleep  eat and had no interest in socialising  Although it was a few months it was so intense for me as she was my first and it was the first girl who had really shown any interest  so it was a bit of a shock to the system and I just couldn t handle it when it finished  It took me a good   months to get fully over her  we both went out every weekend and sort of mix in the same circles so I saw her a few times and my heart would just sink every time I saw her   I am now fully over her and I actually feel I have a grown as a person because of it  and we talk occasionally now and I would consider her as a friend  However the same sort of thing happened again recently and it has hit me just as hard  The worst thing is that I thought I had grown out of this and thought I was stronger  but it seems like it s just reassured me that I just can t handle whatever this is  I can t just  get over it   I just find it all so constant and exhausting  It s not like I don t have a support group  I have a brilliant group of friends who I see constantly throughout the week  and I just feel like I shouldn t be like this  There are people much worse off than me  but I m just never going to be happy   I don t want to kill myself  I just don t want to be alive
summary: In the last years I have never been truly happy. I am sensitive and things affect me more than others. My first girlfriend broke up with me after a few months and it crushed me. Recently another one of these things happened and it has hit me just as hard. I have a brilliant group of friends who I see constantly throughout the week.
cleaned: year truly happy sensitive thing affect girlfriend break month crush recently thing happen hit hard brilliant group friend constantly week

text: Advice about boys from a boy   Tokyo drift So I saw the two prior posts about advice from boys they both nailed it    so I thought I d throw my hat in the ring  This is more of a story than a list of advice  but there s still a valuable lesson to share  Anyways  on with the story Our tale begins in mid December last year  covid was unheard of  and people were looking to the new year with excitement and optimism   I was working as a stage crew member of my school s Production  One day  during one of our breaks  I was sitting alone  flicking through my phone mindlessly  A girl  sitting with her friends  called me over  She started asking questions  what my hobbies were  what subjects I did  etc  After a while  I left to do some tasks for a teacher At the time  I was really confused as to why she did this  we had barely spoken before  But later that evening I realized  she saw me sitting by myself  assumed I was lonely and called me over  That small act of kindness stuck to me  and I m certain i m gonna remember it for the rest of my life  Any time I watch the news and lose hope in humanity  I remember the kindness that that girl showed me Moral of the story This applies to everyone  boys  girls and everyone inbetween  you have no idea how  much a tiny act of kindness can help someone
summary: In December last year a girl called a stage crew member of her school production over and asked him about his hobbies and interests. That small act of kindness stuck to him and he will remember it for the rest of his life. Moral of the story applies to everyone.
cleaned: december year girl call stage crew member school production ask hobby interest small act kindness stick remember rest life moral story apply
